data.title: Add an option to remember side-by-side git diff cursor/editor position
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Fedora 22

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to a git repo. Make some some local changes in a file in the repo.
2. Open the git side-by-side diff: Under "Source Control: (git)", double-click the file that changed.
3. A pane appears with a side-by side view. Scroll away from the initial position by pressing PgDn a few times.
4. Switch to another pane showing something else (open a file in a new pane if no other pane exists).
5. Switch back to the original side-by-side diff pane. Observe that the position has been reset to the initial position and is not the same as how you left it at Step 4.

Expected behavior: The cursor and scroll position should be preserved, not reset in response to focus change.

data.title: Cmd-W ignores the About window
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the program.
2. Select "About Visual Studio Code" from the "Code" menu.
3. Press Cmd-W.  The "Welcome" tab (or whatever tab you have open) in the window behind the About window will close, instead of the About window.

If this isn't the right project to submit the bug on, please direct me to the correct one. (I have no other Electron based apps against which to test the issue)

data.title: settings search does not search entire "file"
data.body:
Testing #27480 (but not related to that issue).

Open settings (CMD or CTRL + comma)
Search for `svn`
Result: no results

Expected: match `files.exclude` settings...

``` json
  // Configure glob patterns for excluding files and folders.
  "files.exclude": {
    "**/.git": true,
    "**/.svn": true,
    "**/.hg": true,
    "**/CVS": true,
    "**/.DS_Store": true
  },
```

data.title: editor.multiCursorModifier ctrl/cmd settings are not portable between OS
data.body:
Testing #27480 

On Windows...
open a folder, create a workspace settings file
Add "editor.multiCursorModifier": "ctrl"
Save
Check in the repo somewhere

On MacOS...
check out the folder/repo created above
open workspace settings
"editor.multiCursorModifier": "ctrl" is now flagged as a warning

data.title: Feature-Request: Document/Selection Formatting to support vertical alignment
data.body: It would be nice to have an option in settings to align the variable assignments vertically when format document is called. I know that there are extensions like [vscode-align](https://github.com/steve8708/vscode-align) but the problem is, after manually invoking vscode-align if you invoke format document the entire vertical alignment is reset to default format.

data.title: Editor: broken font render with UTF-8 text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Paste the following UTF-8 into a new editor
    ```
    AF,03,7052903,Firing wa Ghārū,Firing wa Gharu,7052903
    AF,03,7052904,Guz̄argāh-e Nūr,Guzargah-e Nur,7052904
    AF,03,7052905,Khinjān,Khinjan,7052905
    ```

2. Observe that the font on line 2 does not keep fixed-width display proportions

data.title: Wrong match in Settings search
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open User Settings
2. Type "long" in search bar

Expected: "long" in Settings file matched and highlighted
Actual: One setting "window.title" matched. The highlighted text is "g. V" in this line:
```
// ${appName}: e.g. VS Code
```

data.title: Suggest widget should reflow when window size changes
data.body:
Moving from #27673

Testing: #27315

I think the widget should re-flow it's layout on a window resize e.g. move below the content in a small window and the back to the right in a wide window.
![respond](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/26609814/5a653264-4558-11e7-8815-322cea0c67f2.gif)

data.title: Suggest widget to large in very small windows
data.body:
Testing #27315 

In a very, very small window the suggest widget does not size well - it all by itself is too tall and too wide.

This gets worse when you toggle as you don't know what happened and what mode the toggle is in.

This seams like a flaw we have today that's now just a little worse rather than something new and I did make the window small + zoomed :)

Sean
![small](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/26610008/cb74fad8-4559-11e7-800d-08988a240884.gif)

data.title: Allow getTreeItem be Thenable
data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27467

`getChildren` is Thenable but `getTreeItem` is not. Sometimes we only do real business only when users click on TreeItem but right now we have to populate all data to TreeItem synchronously in `getTreeItem` or do that  asynchronously in `getChildren`, none of them are perfect.

Take Git History view as example, `getChildren` always returns commit list or changed files list, which can be done in `getChildren` asynchronously. But when users click on a changed file, I want to save both the original file content and the modified content to local disk and feed them to `vscode.diff` to do diff, I don't have an async way to fetch/save those content.

```
getTreeItem(element: T): TreeItem | Thenable<TreeItem>;
```
will be really awesome.

data.title: Inconsistent position of keyboard shortcuts in the new menu
data.body: Testing #27454 The keyboard shortcuts for `Command Palette` and `Settings` are right aligned but the one for `Keyboard Shortcuts` is not and has brackets. Can we not keep all 3 consistent?

data.title: Aria-label missing in quick links
data.body:
Testing #27430 

The below links have text that are self-explanatory and so do not need aria-label

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/26608856/a15331cc-4552-11e7-898a-885eb002fd2c.png)

But the links in **Recent** section list out folder names. In these links an aria-label like "Open folder" followed by the folder name followed by "with path" followed by the folder path would help screenreader users

The "More.." link in the **Recent** section should have an aria-label "Open list of recent folders"

data.title: workspaceContains activation event does not fire when debugging the extension host
data.body:
Testing #27483 

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (afe47dc84467b487ce0079ff72f55e7ef4f7ebca, 2017-05-30T09:59:32.734Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vetur|octref|0.6.10|
|java|redhat|0.4.0|
|todotasks|sandy081|0.4.0|
|kustovscode|seanmcbreen|0.0.4|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|1.1.0|;

I could not get this to work.  I did a very simple test of changing the boiler plate hello world `package.json` to:
```
    "activationEvents": [
        "onCommand:extension.sayHello",
        "workspaceContains:**/*.md"
    ],
```

I also tried 
```
    "activationEvents": [
        "onCommand:extension.sayHello",
        "workspaceContains:**/*.kusto"
    ],
```

I then ran this in a folder that had both `.md` and a `.kusto` files.  I did not manage to activate the extension via the presence of these files and as a result did not get the Hello World info message.

My code compiled and I could get to the message via the command.  I could also get this to work with e traditional activation event:
```
    "activationEvents": [
        "onCommand:extension.sayHello",
        "workspaceContains:README.md"
    ],
```

data.title: Improve Docs for Activation Events
data.body:
Testing #27483 

The in-product intellisense should have some descriptions on how these events work/act i.e.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/26608479/a270f4b0-4550-11e7-83b7-fdc2aa49f7d3.png)

It seams like `*` should also be in our list of valid (albeit not preferred) options.

Should be closer to:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/26608499/c7f3507a-4550-11e7-8ab4-3e360f06c604.png)

Additionally on the documentation page some of the options are not covered - specifically 'OnView' I'm actually not sure I know that one ;)
https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/activation-events

data.title: Links inside link in Quick links in Welcome page
data.body:
Testing #27430

Accessibility wise, its not a good idea to have multiple clickable areas inside a bigger clickable area

Since you have "more" and "others" in "Tools and languages" and "Install keyboard shortcuts" links, I'd suggest to remove the the link on the parent

data.title: Unclear what exactly gets installed when clicking on the links in Tools and Languages
data.body:
Testing #27430

It is unclear to the user, what exactly gets installed when clicking on the links in Tools and Languages.

Do we install just the extension? Is it more? 

The pop up should convey this information.

Some users might be wary to click "Ok" if they dont know what they are signing up for.

data.title: Changes to jakefile doesnt reflect in task list
data.body:
Testing #27472

- Create a jakefile as instructed in #27472 with 2 tasks
- Run task shows both
- Now delete one of the tasks, add another
- Run task still shows the deleted task and doesnt show the new one

data.title: Cannot focus docs with VoiceOver enabled
data.body:

- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Testing #27315

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable VoiceOver
2. Open content assist and try to pass focus to docs with Ctrl + Option + Space
3. -> VoiceOver starts reading the entire document

I think I'm using VoiceOver with its default settings.

1. Open content assist with docs collapsed
2. First item is read (assuming #27655 doesn't hit)
3. Ctrl + Space to expand docs
4. Docs are not read, I have to navigate the list first, before docs are read.
